Required reading:

* Williams, K. (2005) ‘”Caught between a rock and a hard place”: police experiences with the legitimacy of street watch partnerships’, The Howard Journal, 44(5): 527-537.
http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/j.1468-2311.2005.00395.x

* Power, K., McElroy, J. and Swanson, V. (1997) ‘Coping abilities and prisoners’ perception of suicidal risk management’, The Howard Journal, 36(4): 378-392.
https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10.1111/1468-2311.00066


Further reading:

* Mays, N., Pope, C. (2000) ‘Assessing quality in qualitative research’, British Medical Journal, 320 : 50-52. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.320.7226.50

* O’Cathain, A. (2010) ‘Assessing the quality of mixed methods research: toward a comprehensive framework’, in C. Teddlie and A. Tashakkori (eds) Sage Handbook of Mixed Methods in Social and Behavioral Research, 2nd ed., London: Sage, pp. 531-555.

* Spencer, L., Ritchie, J., J. Lewis and Dillon, L. (2003) Quality in Qualitative Evaluation: A framework for assessing research evidence: a quality framework, London: The Cabinet Office. Read Chapter IV ‘Content of the framework’, pp. 7-15. https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/government-social-research-framework-for-assessing-research-evidence
